Not sure what type of cutting you do but in my
experience cutting with one hand is a lot less likely
to roll than with two. FWIW. Bob Elder 
still trying to figure it all out...
--- excelsiorilluminati <excelsiorilluminati@...>
wrote:

> Hi Guys, I just followed this thread on both Yahoo
> forums and found 
> it interesting and humourous. There was a lot of
> testing done at the 
> execution grounds and it seems probable that a sword
> of particularly 
> heavy weight and special construction would be used
> to test ones 
> abilities in a one handed stroke. I would hate to be
> the prisoner, 
> as, the one handed grip has a tendency to turn in
> the cut. Most 
> executions being done by low ranking bushi. I do not
> think that it 
> would be used because of the rain though. There
> would be plenty of 
> attendants to assist with the restraints, guarding,
> official 
> recorders and their attendants that someone could
> hold an umbrella or 
> construct cover. The thought of the executioner
> calling "Bring the 
> special umbrella holding one handed in the rain
> sword" is what 
> brought a smile to my face. John
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
